snippet: Of the seven other European Union countries slated to join, none meet all the criteria for economic performance, budget discipline or central bank independence.
abstract: Lithuania receives passing grade from the European Central Bank and the European Commission on requirements for membership to euro zone; Lithuania may be the last new member of the euro zone until the end of the decade, as none of the other seven European Countries planning to join meet all the criteria.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and JAMES KANTER

lead_paragraph: Of the seven other European Union countries slated to join, none meet all the criteria for economic performance, budget discipline or central bank independence.

headline.main: Lithuania Moves Closer to Joining Euro Zone
headline.print_headline: Lithuania Moves Closer to Euro; Few Others Seem Eager to Adopt
